summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 among law enforcement officials (NYPD/FBI Task Force and a US Attorney) discussing investigative steps in the Epstein case. It covers plans to interview a publicist, R. Couri Hay, about statements Epstein made regarding his conduct, and to meet with two sisters who worked with Epstein and may have information about coercive sexual encounters.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: A publicist referenced in New York Times stories who had a conversation with Jeffrey Epstein about Epstein's prior conduct and his reputation; law enforcement seeks to interview him, potentially with a subpoena.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force member involved in coordinating interviews and subpoena service for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation; discussed as having told R. Couri Hay that his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia and that the girls were 'tweens and teens'.

connections.description: Epstein spoke with Hay about improving his reputation and discussed the nature of his prior conduct, indicating Hay was a contact Epstein confided in.
Byrne is tasked with assisting in interviewing Hay, showing a law enforcement-investigative target relationship.

events.title: Planned interview of R. Couri Hay
events.description: Law enforcement plans to interview publicist R. Couri Hay regarding his conversation with Jeffrey Epstein about Epstein's prior conduct and reputation; a subpoena is prepared if he declines an informal interview.

events.title: Planned meeting with Epstein-associated sisters
events.description: Prosecutors plan to meet with two sisters, one who previously worked with Epstein, who may have useful information and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.

events.title: Epstein's conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Epstein told publicist R. Couri Hay that his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia, asserting the girls were 'tweens and teens', as reported in New York Times stories.

keyFacts: Law enforcement in July 2019 was actively pursuing leads, including interviewing publicist R. Couri Hay about statements Epstein made regarding his conduct.
Epstein told R. Couri Hay that his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia and that the girls involved were 'tweens and teens', indicating his perspective on the allegations.

Investigators planned to meet with two sisters who worked with Epstein; they were not believed to be underage victims but may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.
The email chain shows coordination between the US Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) and the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force.
A subpoena was prepared for R. Couri Hay, indicating the formal investigative pressure being applied to gather information.
